meanings.definition: Having the same name or designation.
meanings.sent1: The two homonymous twins confused everyone with their identical names.
meanings.sent2: The homonymous streets in the city made it easy to get lost.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how the homonymous actors kept mixing up their scripts.
meanings.sent4: The homonymous books on the shelf seemed to mirror each other's titles.
meanings.sent5: The homonymous flowers in the garden bloomed in perfect symmetry.

meanings.definition: Having the same sound but different meanings.
meanings.sent1: The homonymous words 'bat' and 'bat' have different meanings in baseball and nature.
meanings.sent2: The homonymous 'bark' of a dog and a tree can be easily distinguished by context.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to hear the homonymous phrases used in a comedy show.
meanings.sent4: The homonymous sounds of the city created a unique urban symphony.
meanings.sent5: The homonymous notes in the music piece added depth and complexity to the composition.

meanings.sent1: The homonymous dictionary provided definitions for confusing words.
meanings.sent2: The homonymous lesson focused on understanding word variations.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the homonymous examples in the language textbook.
meanings.sent4: The homonymous quiz challenged students to differentiate between similar words.
meanings.sent5: The homonymous study group helped students grasp the concept of word similarities.
